channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Disgraced BHS entrepreneur, 52, is dumped by his 37-year-old wife
item.description: Dominic Chappell, 52, is living in a hotel after his 37-year-old wife, Rebecca Chappell, threw him out of their Tudor manor house in Dorset. Mrs Chappell is understood to be filing for divorce.

item.title: England's schools get powers to appeal GCSE/A-level results
item.description: England's exams regulator has said schools and colleges can appeal if they can prove that historical data used to standardise grades is not a reliable indicator of this year's results.

item.title: BBC receives more than 18,000 complaints over N-word broadcast
item.description: BBC journalist Fiona Lamdin, left, used a racially offensive slur during a news broadcast on July 29 when interviewing the victim of a racist hit and run attack in Bristol.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: We must shut down city pubs if selfish young drinkers can't keep distance
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: Last week's lockdown in Manchester brought absolutely no difference to the numbers swanning about on Friday night, hoping to get hammered.

item.title: Coronavirus: Asymptomatic patients shed just as much of virus
item.description: A new study from Soonchunhyang University Seoul Hospital in South Korea found the viral loads of asymptomatic coronavirus patients were very similar to those seen in patients with symptoms.

item.title: Britain gets its first Dutch-style roundabout that gives priority to cyclists
item.description: Cyclists have an outer ring on the Cambridge roundabout, with cycle crossings over each of the four approach roads in a contrasting red surface.

item.title: Three migrants rescued from sinking kayak by builder swimming from Dover to Calais for charity
item.description: Three migrants were spotted by builder Justin Legge, 49, from Bridge near Canterbury, Kent, in a sinking inflatable kayak worth £299.99 10 miles away from Dover at around 3.30pm.

item.title: Armed man 'holds six hostage' inside bank in Le Havre, France
item.description: Although the man, believed to be in possession of a revolver, has since released two hostages, the situation at the BRED bank on Boulevard de Strasbourge remains ongoing.

item.title: New York AG Letitia James sues to dissolve the NRA
item.description: New York's famously anti-Trump Attorney General Letitia James announced on Thursday that she is suing the NRA, claiming its leadership used the organization as a 'personal piggy bank'.

item.title: Gunman crashes motorbike and dies during police chase after shooting 42-year-old man in Hampshire
item.description: Locals said James Nash, whose wife is a top space scientist, is in hospital being treating for gun shot wounds following a shooting in Upper Enham, Hants, yesterday.

item.title: Beirust explosion: Politician blames Hezbollah and government
item.description: Bahaa Hariri, 54, said last night that everyone in the city knew Hezbollah controlled Beirut's port and airport and it was inconceivable authorities did not know the deadly ammonium nitrate.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres bullied 11-year-old boy by calling him 'fat' and 'stupid'
item.description: Ben Gravolet, 52, told DailyMailTV that 'vile' Ellen DeGeneres bullied him as an 11-year-old boy, calling him 'fat' and 'stupid' when the TV host worked for his mother in the 1970s in New Orleans.

item.title: Fears over UK ammonium nitrate storage after Beirut explosion
item.description: Explosives and safety experts say a Beirut-style mega-blast could not happen in the UK - because of strict production and storage rules on the substance linked to the tragedy

item.title: Mariah Carey's sister Alison accuses their mother of forcing her to perform sex acts on strangers
item.description: The sister of Mariah Carey, has filed a summons with notice naming her mother Patricia as a defendant. Alison Carey, 57, claims she was sexually abused as a girl of ten.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Bride returns to scene of wedding video
item.description: The dramatic footage captured the moment when a massive explosion rocked the Lebanese capital on Tuesday, killing 135 people and injuring more than 5,000.

item.title: Pensioners shout at passenger without mask to 'get off the bus'
item.description: Angry passengers got into a heated row with a man on a bus in Liverpool on Wednesday evening, after he came on to the bus without wearing a face mask, despite Government regulations.

item.title: Heavily-pregnant woman and young children are among migrants to land on Kent beach
item.description: The group of around 16 refugees including 10 young children and a heavily pregnant woman landed on Dungeness beach in Kent around 8.30am.

item.title: Eat, Shop, Save: Family saves £550 and lose stone in 8 weeks
item.description: Sergio and Fatima Paiva live with their daughters Helena, 16, and Victoria, four, in Southport, and appear on ITV's Eat, Shop, Save tonight, completing a challenge to become healthier and save money.

item.title: Bombproof luxury penthouse in MI6 HQ goes on sale for £5.5m
item.description: The stunning penthouse located over the top three floors of the prominent Whitehall Court in central London was once the home of Sir Mansfield Smith-Cumming.

item.title: Dog stands still for over a minute in hilarious stand-off with frog
item.description: Denver, a four-year-old Vizsla from New Hampshire, spotted a frog in a pond and stood in waiting, motionless.The Hungarian breed is a natural hunting dog with a great sense of smell.

item.title: Coronavirus: 53 on Norwegian cruise ship test positive
item.description: Following the outbreak on the MS Roald Amundsen, the ship's owner halted all cruises on Monday and Norway closed its ports to cruise ships for two weeks.

item.title: M&S copies Waitrose's most popular items to boost online food deliveries
item.description: M&S has developed 750 new items and copied some of arch-rival Waitrose's grocery items ahead of the launch of its new grocery delivery service with Ocado across the UK next month.

item.title: Russia jails three in penal colony for 'plotting to overthrow Putin'
item.description: Ruslan Kostylenkov, 27, Pyotr Karamzin, 34, and Vyacheslav Kryukov, 22, were handed the sentences today by a Moscow Court.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Two-thirds think there'll be a second lockdown
item.description: A nationwide survey commissioned by blood testing company Medichecks found one in five people in July believed they had already had Covid-19 despite not having tested positive.

item.title: Knifeman who killed Arsenal fan at Tube station faces life in jail
item.description: Tashan Daniel, a talented 200 metre sprinter, was on his way to see Arsenal play Nottingham Forest when he was stabbed in the chest by Alex Lanning, 23, at Hillingdon tube station.

item.title: Scientists create the 'brightest material on Earth'
item.description: University of Copenhagen and Indiana University scientists created the new materials that has a brilliant glow from positively charged fluorescent dyes.

item.title: London Marathon set to go ahead on October 4 but will take a different route with only elite runners
item.description: Organisers confirmed that the 2020 race on October 4 will only include elite runners, who will complete 19.8 laps of an enclosed course at St James' Park and finish at The Mall without spectators.

item.title: Noel Gallagher spent £1,000 so woman could hit sales targets
item.description: Audrey Indome, from London, revealed on Twitter that Noel Gallagher once bought 10 pairs of black Levi's 501s so she could reach her sales target while working at Selfridges.

item.title: Oar-some encounter! Friendly seal tries to hitch a ride on a rower's boat in the Thames
item.description: Chris Van Hayden was rowing with his friend Salvatore Chiocca on the River Thames in west London at the end of July when he filmed a seal climbing on to the boat.
item.media:credit: London Blue Badge Tour Guide / Chris Van Hayden

item.title: Test and Trace is getting WORSE: Number of contacts of coronavirus patients drops again to 72.4%
item.description: Data shows that 72.4 per cent of close contacts of Covid-19 patients were reached by NHS call handlers in the week ending July 29.

item.title: Shoppers mock ASOS knitted bralette for looking like a SCARF
item.description: British online fashion retailer ASOS, has been mocked by Instagram users after sharing a photograph of a model wearing the £55 Simonett Nanu knitted bralette crop top.

item.title: Homeowner who raised bottom of his sloping lawn by 20 inches wins battle with neighbours to keep it
item.description: Father Matthew Williams, 36, caused a storm in Pentre Nicklaus Village at Llanelli, south Wales, by raising the bottom of his garden by 20 inches.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Last photo emerges of firefighters before blast
item.description: A tragic last photo has emerged showing firefighters prying open a door at Beirut's Warehouse 12 just moments before it exploded with the force of a small nuke.

item.title: Captain of ship that carried explosives to Lebanon says he warned of dangers
item.description: Boris Prokoshev, who was at the helm of tanker Rhosus in 2013 when it was detained in Lebanon says he wrote to Vladimir Putin every month with a warning over the 'powder keg' cargo.

item.title: Robert Jenrick denies planning revolution will create 'slums' to hit government targets
item.description: The dramatic shake-up - billed as the biggest since the Second World War - vows to slash red tape and fast-track developments, while insisting they must be 'beautiful'.

item.title: The village at war over £400,000 eco-house
item.description: June Titterton-Fox, 61, wants to create the single-storey home in one of the two fields she owns in the Rutland village of Whitwell - and she has said it would be one of Britain's most energy-efficient properties.

item.title: The Oxfordshire villages that fear Boris Johnson's new planning laws
item.description: A four-year battle has been taking place over the proposed Chalgrove Airfield development for a new market town of 3,000 homes and four schools in the Oxfordshire countryside.

item.title: Fauci says US has the worst COVID-19 outbreak in the world
item.description: Dr Anthony Fauci said the US has 'quantitatively' suffered from the pandemic as the country averages nearly 60,000 new cases and 1,000 deaths per day.

item.title: Caroline Flack: Coroner rules suicide due to fear of prosecution
item.description: The 40-year-old was found dead on February 15, the day after she had learned the Crown Prosecution Service was pursuing charges that she allegedly attacked Lewis Burton.

item.title: UK weather: Beaches and beauty spots prepare for surge of visitors
item.description: Temperatures will be above 86F (30C) every day from today until at least next Tuesday, with the Met Office issuing a level three heat health alert which warns Britons to look out for the elderly.

item.title: Europe's extreme droughts could increase by seven times by 2100
item.description: Computer modelling from German and Czech researchers predict that two-year droughts will increase seven-fold in number across Europe between 2051 and 2100.

item.title: Environmental activist, 17, says coronavirus is a byproduct of mistreating the planet
item.description: Environmental activist Bella Lack, 17, from South West London claimed on This Morning today that coronavirus and other Zoonotic diseases are a byproduct of mistreating the planet.

item.title: Meghan Markle will interview co-founder of virtual summit on gender and politics
item.description: Meghan Markle, will appear at The 19th* Represents 2020 Virtual Summit, which features a series of conversations with prominent women in US politics, journalism and the arts.

item.title: Prince Harry's royal biographer Angela Levin says he has become 'a shadow of his former self'
item.description: Angela Levin, who wrote Harry: Conversations with the Prince in 2018, appeared on ITV's Royal Rota and revealed that the Duke of Sussex, 35, had 'changed enormously' since their first meeting.

item.title: Thousands of Covid-19 deaths 'to be wiped off the government's official toll' after counting fiasco
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock last month ordered an urgent review into how daily death counts are calculated by Public Health England because of a 'statistical flaw'.

item.title: Eating too much rice increases your risk of dying from heart disease
item.description: Researchers at the universities of Manchester and Salford studied rice consumption in England and Wales and prevalence of cardiovascular diseases caused by arsenic exposure.

item.title: Lava tubes on Mars and the Moon are up to 1,000 times bigger than those on Earth
item.description: Researchers at the Universities of Bologna and Padua studied the subsurface cavities that lava created billions of years ago under the surface of Mars and the Moon.

item.title: Cleaner, 47, appears in court over Tamara Ecclestone theft
item.description: A cleaner caught with £300,000 earrings stolen after a raid on Tamara Ecclestone's home says she has no idea who two of her co-defendants are. Maria Mester, 47, denies charges

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 950 new cases and 49 deaths in official toll
item.description: Department of Health statistics show 835 Britons are now getting diagnosed each day - with the rolling seven-day average having consistently risen since it dropped to a four-month low on July 8 (546).

item.title: Thousands of giant planets or 'blanets' surround black hole, say scientists
item.description: Black hole 'safe zones' could host thousands of blanets. These exoplanets may have formed from ice-covered dust swirling around the black hole and likely have 30,000 times the mass of Earth.

item.title: Boris Johnson pumps iron as he urges Britons to help the recovery
item.description: Boris Johnson hailed 'signs of strength' in the UK economy as he said it was crucial for people to return to their normal duties.

item.title: Explorer exposes the dramatic impact of global warming in stark pictures
item.description: Chilean explorer and photographer Cristian Donoso has dedicated the last 24 years of his life to exposing the impact of climate change in more than 50 expeditions.
item.media:credit: Alberto de Agostini / Museo Salesiano Maggiorino Borgatello

item.title: UK parents copy celebrity trend to 'have children of both sexes'
item.description: Researchers found much more families than expected kept having children until they have at least one boy and one girl, just like the Beckhams and the Kardashian family.

item.title: Want a last-minute staycation? Try a youth hostel in the Peak District, known as the English Alps
item.description: After foreign holidays hit the wall and UK B&Bs sold out, Jake Wallis Simons plumped for a family youth hostel break in the Peak District - and had no regrets whatsoever.

item.title: Police's e-fit mocked over suspect's 'Etch A Sketch' beard
item.description: Northamptonshire Police released the image of the suspect with the picture showing the man with black beard covering most of his face and a bizarre large black line running from his ear to his head.

item.title: Chinese man has 29 magnetic beads stuck in his bladder
item.description: The patient went to a hospital in north-western China's Shaanxi Province after allegedly starting to pee blood and feeling pain while urinating. He refused to explain why he had stuck the balls into himself.

item.title: Britain's most popular rural retreats are revealed
item.description: Rightmove said it is seeing an uplift in UK city dwellers considering moving to the countryside - and this is outperforming an increase it is also seeing in home hunters looking to move from a city to a town.

item.title: Coronavirus: Could gum disease make infection more deadly?
item.description: Researchers in California and Brazil say that COVID-19 patients with high levels of interleukin-6 (IL-6), that suggests someone has. gum disease were far more likely to need ventilators to stay alive.
item.media:credit: Journal of the California Dental Association

item.title: Anger mounts against Lebanon's government following Beirut blast
item.description: Lebanon's prime minister has threatened retaliation against those responsible for a massive explosion which levelled parts of Beirut, but anger and blame is turning against politicians the themselves.

item.title: JLR develops software so autonomous cars won't make you travel sick
item.description: Britain's biggest car maker has created a rating system for driverless technology - called a 'wellness score' - that designers claim can reduce the impact of travel sickness by up to 60%.

item.title: Port worker is found bloodied but alive 30 hours after being blown into the sea by Beirut blast
item.description: Port of Beirut worker Amin al-Zahed, whose photo was posted on an Instagram page dedicated to locating missing residents, was found in the Mediterannean sea, 30 hours after the blast.

item.title: Bank of England says unemployment could hit 7.4 per cent this year
item.description: Governor Andrew Bailey said the crisis would bring 'structural' change and some sectors were unlikely to be 'viable' as the deadly disease overhauls everyday life.

item.title: High Court judge fears libel trial of ex-MI6 agent Christopher Steele was live-streamed to Russia
item.description: Christopher Steele was sued by Russian businessman Aleksej Gubarev after producing a 2016 dossier about alleged links between Donald Trump and Russia.

item.title: Wetherspoons set to cut 130 staff at its head office as Covid jobs bloodbath continues
item.description: The pub and restaurant sector is in a downturn, said Wetherspoon chief executive John Hutson as pub chain becomes the latest to announce imminent job losses due to coronavirus pandemic
item.media:description: The company´s pubs have reopened following the Covid-19 lockdown. (Aaron Chown/PA)

item.title: 242m-year-old reptile's neck was three times longer than torso
item.description: CT scans of the weird 20-foot-long creature and its incredible giraffe-like 10-foot long neck reveal it lived in water and was 'surprisingly adaptable' 242 million years ago.

item.title: Lorry driver who killed two in M58 crash was using phone apps
item.description: James Majury, 33, opened a number of apps as well as sending text messages to his mother moments before he ploughed his HGV into the back of a school minibus on the M58 in Lancashire

item.title: Two people are stabbed in brawl at California hotel near Disneyland that involved 100 people
item.description: A massive fight broke out between guests staying at the Cambria Hotel in Anaheim, California, on Wednesday following an incident at the pool involving an 11-year-old and his cousin.

item.title: Twitter mob rounds on Kirstie Allsopp after she suggested employees SHOULD return to the office
item.description: The Location, Location, Location presenter sparked a social media row after warning employers could replace Brits working from home with cheaper staff from overseas.

item.title: Backpacker had no idea nine months pregnant travel sickness LABOUR gave birth baby boy qld motorway
item.description: Abi was on a bus from Brisbane to Fraser Island when she stopped to get painkillers for what she thought was period pain in Noosa. She had the 1.7 kg baby boy on the way to hospital

item.title: Germany demands UK is more 'realistic and pragmatic' in Brexit trade talks
item.description: Berlin's Europe minister Michael Roth said he was 'disappointed' with the UK's tough stance amid rising fears that the negotiations could fail.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's mother describes watching his killers 'laughing' in court
item.description: Appearing by video link from her home in Oxfordshire, Debbie Adlam, 53, slammed her son's killers for 'laughing and joking' in court.

item.title: Brexiteer, 73, admits sending party leader Anna Soubry email telling her to 'remember' MP Jo Cox
item.description: Keith Willard, from Essex, sent the message in August last year to then-MP Anna Soubry - a former Conservative MP for Broxtowe, Notts, who later led independent party Change UK.

item.title: Up to half a million Britons are suffering the effects of 'long Covid', MPs told
item.description: The founder of the Long Covid Support Group, Claire Hastie, said, 'Many people in our group to this day are being told by their GPs that it's caused by anxiety and it's all in their heads.'

item.title: Prince Charles to extend Balmoral holiday as 'fishing is so good'
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, and the Duchess of Cornwall, 73, kicked off their break at their Scottish residence of Birkhall this week after he paid a visit to Caithness General Hospital in Wick on Friday, Hello! reported.

item.title: Air hostess 'needlessly' evacuated jet on Stansted runway injuring 10 passengers
item.description: The incident happened after an engine of the A320-214 jet suddenly failed while it was building up speed to take off from the Essex airport last year.

item.title: Hollywood slammed for censoring films to please CHINA
item.description: Movies which the report says have been artistically compromised by the Communist paymasters include Bohemian Rhapsody, Iron Man III, and the upcoming Top Gun remake.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Manchester Royal Mail delivery office hit
item.description: Contract tracing has begun and a mobile testing unit is being set up at the Manchester Delivery Office on Oldham Road. Union expects staff to be tested within three days.

item.title: Police officer caught in sting operation stole £100 from wallet
item.description: Matthew Rollason, 38, who served with Gloucestershire Police, was on duty and in uniform when he was given the wallet with wads of cash inside by a member of the public at the races

item.title: Boris Johnson defends not suspending senior Tory MP accused of rape
item.description: Speaking about the case for the first time, Boris Johnson insisted the situation was being taken 'extremely seriously'.

item.title: Police advised to still automatically believe alleged abuse victims in guidelines despite warnings
item.description: The UK College of Policing guidance, which was published today, controversially tells detectives investigating claims of child abuse that 'the intention is that victims are believed'.

item.title: Is an interest rate cut this year now off the cards?
item.description: The comments follow the Bank's unanimous monetary policy committee vote to keep interest rates on hold at 0.1 per cent.

item.title: How did they walk away from THIS? Driver escapes horror M1 lorry smash with 'minor injuries'
item.description: A BMW was left a mangled wreck when it was crushed between two trucks near junction 24 for Loughborough yesterday, but remarkable the driver wasn't badly hurt in the smash.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Firefighters who died as blast hit warehouse
item.description: Jo Noon, Methal Hawwa and Najib Hitti were part of a 10-person rapid response team that is all missing, with one female colleague, Sahar Faris, who was due to be married, confirmed dead.

item.title: Thrifty mothers show off huge CHRISTRMAS present hauls
item.description: With less than 200 days until December 25th, some eager British mothers have showcased their bargain buys from Argos, Asda and Entertainer sales that they plan to keep as presents.

item.title: Robert Jenrick 'regrets' dinner with Tory donor before approving £1billion housing development
item.description: Housing Secretary said he wished he had not sat with Richard Desmond at an event just weeks before approving Westferry Printworks scheme before it could be hit by a local development levy.

item.title: Hydroxychloroquine could save tens of thousands of lives from Covid-19 but it's been politicised
item.description: British researchers behind the only large global trial of hydroxychloroquine as a prophylaxis say their work is in jeopardy because the drug has become politicised thanks to Donald Trump.

item.title: Supercar swerves across traffic and speeds down slip road seconds before police car appears
item.description: Dashcam footage captured on August 1 shows the moment an orange car speeds across two lanes of cars to take an exit. The incident happened on the A3 heading towards Portsmouth in Hampshire.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Homicide ruled out for Belly Mujinga death
item.description: Prosecutors have ruled out murder charges over the death of Belly Mujinga. The 47-year-old was spat at by a man while working at London Victoria station and died two weeks later, in April, with Covid-19.

item.title: Fears for holidays as travel experts warn France 'is highly likely' to be added to quarantine list
item.description: Travellers from France could soon face a 14 days of self-isolation on their return to the UK following a dramatic rise in coronavirus cases, according to travel experts.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein victim recalls being abused as a 19-year-old virgin
item.description: A former model and one of the alleged victims of Jeffery Epstein has recalled how she was assaulted by him in 2004 when she was just 19 years old, struggling for rent in New York City.

item.title: Want to cash in on stamp duty relief? Experts share top tips to help you sell your home
item.description: Here experts including estate agents and interior designers reveals their top tips and tricks to help you bag a buyer in 2020 and take advantage of the stamp duty holiday for your next purchase.

item.title: Man who punched dog banned from keeping animals for 2 years
item.description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT: Joseph Pocklington was banned from keeping animals for two years after punching his dog in Darlington, County Durham.

item.title: 'Healthy' blue food colouring could soon be brightening up our dinner plates
item.description: Most foods lack the pigment needed to produce blue naturally, but researchers from the University of Cambridge found a shrub that evolved a way to generate blue fruit.

item.title: Ancient 'hell ants' had deadly scythe-like mandibles that they used to pin prey
item.description: The 99 million-year old insect stunningly preserved in amber from Myanmar was trapped just as it embraced its final victim - an ancient relative of the cockroach.

item.title: Heartwarming video captures lost pets being reunited with their owners in Beirut
item.description: Charity workers have been scouring the ruins of Beirut for pets that got lost during the explosion which rocked the city two days ago, as heartwarming video shows them being reunited with their owners.

item.title: Prince Charles and Prince William carried out the MOST royal engagements since start of lockdown
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, had 69 commitments including phone calls, video conferences and in-person engagements from March 23 until July 31, according to the analysis by online firm Resume.io.

item.title: Singapore police trial two pilotless drones to help enforce social distancing measures
item.description: Singapore's police have been trialling two pilotless drones developed by Israel's Airobotics to help enforce social distancing measures aimed at containing the spread of COVID-19.

item.title: Obese woman, 26, who was warned she had pre-diabetes sheds 150LBS
item.description: Danielle Hoshia, 26, from Hoboken, New Jersey, decided 'enough was enough' when reaching her heaviest weight of 294lbs and realizing she was too big to sit in a standard chair.

item.title: Lockdown-defying man who stole police officer's bike fined £85
item.description: Hassan Ali, 23, was filmed riding around on a PCSO's bicycle after they had tried to stop a group of up to 30 men playing cricket in Slough during lockdown in May.

item.title: Essex couple find two migrant stowaways hiding under their van after trip to France
item.description: Dean Darke and wife May caught the men (pictured) crawling out on their driveway in Basildon, Essex, after the journey last Wednesday.

item.title: Ministers 'wasted more than £150million buying face masks that don't work' from investment firm
item.description: Around 50 million FFP2 masks (pictured) supplied by Ayanda Capital had ear straps rather than head straps, which raised 'concern' they may not provide an 'adequate fixing' around the face.

item.title: Violent thug, 43, admits attempting to murder mother, 36, by stabbing her SEVEN times
item.description: Mark Brazant, 44, has admitted trying to kill young mother Josephine Conlon (pictured), who he repeatedly stabbed in Streatham last December, days after being released from prison.

item.title: British artist launches high-tech 'virtual gallery'
item.description: Lincoln Townley, Britain's leading figurative artist, commissioned a team of designers to create digital gallery in order to view art work virtually from anywhere in the world last year.

item.title: Core blimey! Driver demonstrates novel way to cut an apple in half using her car window
item.description: Anna Zhakova, 32, from Saint-Petersburg, Russia, shows off her unique fruit-slicing trick in a video. She places an apple in gap a car window and winds the window up. The apple splits perfectly in two.

item.title: Sexual assault: Opera singer Placido Domingo denies abuse of nine women
item.description: Famed Spanish opera singer Placido Domingo, accused of sexual misconduct, denied the allegations Thursday in an interview in which he talked about getting over coronavirus.

item.title: Prison officer, 26, had sexual relationship with inmate serving life
item.description: Kerianne Stephens, 26, of Aylesford, Kent, was employed at HMP Swaleside on the Isle of Sheppey when she had the affair with 34-year-old Louis Tate.

item.title: Lufthansa warns it does not expect air travel to return to pre-coronavirus levels for FOUR YEARS
item.description: Lufthansa does not expect air travel demand to return to pre-coronavirus crisis levels until at least 2024, as the German airline posted a 1.7 billion euro (£1.53billion) quarterly operating loss.

item.title: Widow sells husband's hoard of 50,000 records for £1 EACH - despite some LPs worth up to £2,000
item.description: The LPs were amassed by John Peel, from Ramsey in the Isle of Man, who shares his name with the famous DJ. He collected music records and box sets at record shops and auctions.

item.title: Erectile dysfunction drug aviptadil may also beat Covid-19, experts believe
item.description: Aviptadil, marketed as Invicorp in the UK, has been fast-tracked into clinical trials in the US after promising signs in a small number of patients in the US.

item.title: Chinese city builds a motorway bridge around a house after its stubborn owner refused to move
item.description: Footage shows the one-storey property tightly wedged between two wings of the newly opened Haizhuyong Bridge in the metropolis of Guangzhou in Guangdong province.

item.title: Father-of-six reveals he's been lying to his felon girlfriend
item.description: Shawn, 45, from Las Vegas, Nevada, fell for his new love Destinie online and saw her in person for the first time when he picked her up from jail.

item.title: Would YOU ditch your dream wedding venue because of its history?
item.description: Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds admitted it had been a 'giant mistake' to marry wife Blake Lively on a former plantation. Here, FEMAIL explores the UK venues with links to the slave trade.

item.title: How the Duchess of Cambridge nailed mask makeup with a bold brow, soft powder and smokey eye
item.description: Makeup artist Lisa Little told FEMAIL the Duchess of Cambridge, 38, has been 'rocking' the mask makeup look as she donned face coverings for royal visits for the first time this week.

item.title: Uighur prisoner reveals China is instructing children as young as 13 to 'regret and surrender'
item.description: Merdan Ghappar, 31, who was once a model for online retailer Taobao, provided a chilling first-hand account of China's highly secure and secretive detention system.

item.title: Cannabis is bad for your HEART: Doctors warn using the drug can trigger heart attacks and strokes
item.description: Smoking and inhaling cannabis has been linked with a slew of damaging heart problems, according to The American Heart Association, who reviewed the available evidence.

item.title: Windsor Castle East Terrace Garden prepares to open for the first time in more than 40 years
item.description: Windsor Castle is to open its East Terrace Garden to the public for the first time in more than 40 years. Created in the 1820s, the garden features 3,500 rose bushes planted around a central fountain.

item.title: Actress considered ending life at Dignitas after rare condition caused paralysis and incontinence
item.description: Kim, now 62, from Bedfordshire, who is known for playing Marilyn Fenner in ITV's Bad Girls, told FEMAIL she was diagnosed with transverse myelitis after collapsing at home in August 2017.

item.title: Website builder reveals the top ten nostalgic sites still live on the internet
item.description: Website building service WebEden has discovered the ten websites that provide the most nostalgia, and now stand as relics of the dial-up age including Dancing Baby and Chicken on a Raft.

item.title: Dramatic footage shows fugitive burglar's Audi A5 ramming police cars in 70mph pursuit
item.description: Patrick Jones, 28, from Liverpool, lead police in a high-speed pursuit along the A500 in Cheshire in November 2018 before fleeing the scene on foot across the dual carriageway.

item.title: Do you have the traits of a genius? Tricky 15-question quiz reveals if you have IQ higher than 151
item.description: The quiz, created by US-based quiz master Terry Stein for Playbuzz, challenges your mental agility, intuitiveness and creative thinking to assess if you have above average intelligence.

item.title: Wayne Lineker, 58, sparks outrage on Twitter as he is filmed pushing women in a pool by their chests
item.description: The O Beach club owner shared the video of him picking his next date at his resort in Ibiza. People on Twitter have branded him 'creepy' after he was seen pushing women in the pool by touching their chests.

item.title: Charlie Mullins says working from home is 'selfish'
item.description: Pimlico Plumbers entrepreneur Charlie Mullins has been criticised after saying those working from home are 'selfish' and 'don't care about the economy' from a Marbella Villa on This Morning.

item.title: Cases of gout are spiralling at an 'astonishing' rate across the world
item.description: Experts at the University of Sydney, who carried out the review, described the pace of increase as 'astonishing'. Evidence is beginning to show the condition is driven by genetics.

item.title: Eleven-year-old is kicked and punched by another girl in park 'attack' as others watch and laugh
item.description: An 11-year-old girl was punched and kicked in a park in Bransholme, Hull, by another girl on August 4. Footage of the shocking incident was shared on social media and police are investigating.

item.title: Princess Anne's 70th birthday party at the palace has been cancelled
item.description: The Princess Royal, who turns 70 next week, had been due to celebrate with a soiree hosted by her mother the Queen, 94, at Buckingham Palace, a source told Vanity Fair.

item.title: Playground manager locked girl in DOG CAGE - but is spared jail despite assaults on three kids
item.description: Peter Mathieson, 40, oversees the upkeep of playgrounds as a boss in a unit in Kirkintilloch, near Glasgow. He was convicted of assaulting three children - aged between one and 13.

item.title: Coronavirus cases continued to fall after some lockdown measures were eased in June
item.description: Some 123 Britons were diagnosed with the infection out of a sample size of nearly 160,000 people between June 18 and July 8, giving an incidence rate of 0.07 per cent.

item.title: Grammy winner and Beyonce producer Detail is arrested on 15 sex assault charges
item.description: Detail, whose real name is Noel Christopher Fisher, was held on nearly $6.3 million bail, according to a statement from the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department.

item.title: Trans man says he is a better role model to his sons after transition
item.description: Adam Walker, 32, from Tennessee, transitioned after giving birth to sons James, ten and Lincoln, five. He's now undergone a double mastectomy and nipple grats and takes testosterone.

item.title: Kate Middleton donned £62 hoop earrings from Welsh female designer yesterday in Wales
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, opted to wear the £62 Alia hoop earrings from Welsh jewellery designer Hayley Jones' Spells of Love brand during her visits to Barry Island and Cardiff yesterday.

item.title: Now you can RENT James Bond's pad! Grand home in Chelsea goes on the market for £3,250 a week
item.description: The elegant property, situated in Wellington Square in Chelsea, south west London, offers almost 3,000 sq ft of spacious family living space and is spread across five floors.

item.title: Schoolboy, 11, was killed by two brown bears in Russia
item.description: Eleven-year-old Nikita had been 'showing off' his 'bravery' in front of two girls at the Russian resort at Sochi and aimed to pose for a photo up close to the wild brown bears.

item.title: West Bromwich woman is dragged along a road as she tries to stop car thief from stealing her Ford
item.description: The victim, who is in her 30s, clings on to the door as Paul Harvey (pictured in a police mugshot) makes off with her Ford C-Max in West Bromwich. Harvey was jailed for six years.

item.title: Dozens more women accuse Ron Jeremy of rape and sexual assault over 20 years
item.description: Jeremy, 67, was charged by prosecutors in Los Angeles in late June after he was accused by four women of historic sexual assault offenses in West Hollywood. Dozens more have since come forward.

item.title: Hogtied inmate yells 'I can't breathe' more than 20 times before his death in North Carolina
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: John Neville, 56, died of a brain injury sustained during cardiac arrest which the coroner ruled was caused by 'asphyxia' at the jail in Winston-Salem.
item.media:description: In this Feb. 12, 2019 image made from video and released by the Forsyth County, (N.C). Jail, authorities restrain John Neville in his cell as a nurse speaks with him, in Winston-Salem, N.C. The body-cam video from the jail shows Neville struggling with jail guards to get up from the floor where he was lying on his back, shouting that he couldn't breathe and calling out "Mama, mama!" before he was hog-tied to restrain him. Neville died at a local hospital of a brain injury on Dec. 4, 2019. (Forsyth County Jail via AP)

item.title: Earbud-like device claims to boost linguistic skills by zapping your ear
item.description: The simple gadget dramatically improves the wearer's ability to learn new words, say the University of Pittsburgh team behind the research new development.

item.title: Arsenal's 'shameful decision' to make 55 staff redundant slammed by Piers Morgan
item.description: On Wednesday, the Gunners announced they were to take cost-cutting measures by letting 55 members of staff go as the coronavirus pandemic continues to negatively impact their finances.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect unlikely to walk free
item.description: Investigators in the Madeleine McCann case breathed a sigh of relief today after the EU's top court moved to block suspect Christian Bruekner's dramatic court bid for release.

item.title: Amazon is accused of 'opting out' of paying fair taxes
item.description: Amazon has announced plans to increase its referral fees, fulfilment by Amazon fees, monthly FBA Storage fees and multichannel fulfilment fees by two per cent for its UK customers.

item.title: Mother reveals how small dent she dismissed as a stretch mark turned out to be breast cancer
item.description: Demelza Jefferis, 42, from Plymouth, Devon, had been getting out of the shower when she accidentally dropped her towel and noticed a strange mark on her breast.

item.title: Teaching union threatens to keep schools shut in September
item.description: Bosses at the National Education Union (NEU), the UK's largest teaching union, say it may be 'impossible' for 'many' schools to reopen at the start of the new academic year.

item.title: Child, four, died after being trapped between two stair-gates
item.description: The child, who is known as AH, died in a hospice in April 2019 following a cardiac arrest three weeks after the accident at their Norfolk home.

item.title: Fisherman holds his nerve as bear snatches a salmon off his line in Alaska
item.description: A man fishing for salmon on the shore of a river in Alaska is approached by a bear. The hungry bear steals the salmon straight from the end of his line. The nail-biting encounter was captured on video.

item.title: Cold callers blamed for test and trace failures due to NHS using 0300 numbers
item.description: The government's Test and Trace service - described as 'world beating' by Boris Johnson - is being hampered by people ignoring calls coming from 0300 numbers.

item.title: Chris van Tulleken watches doctors STOP his identical twin brother Xand's heart
item.description: TV doctor Chris van Tulleken, of London, broke down in tears as he watched doctors stop his identical twin brother Xand's heart in a BBC documentary that aired last night.

item.title: Depictions of AI in the media are 'overwhelmingly white' study finds
item.description: University of Cambridge experts studied the way artificial intelligence was portrayed in media including stock images, cinema and even the dialects of virtual assistance.

item.title: FA sex abuse report delay a 'disgrace', says victim Andy Woodward
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY MIKE KEEGAN: Woodward, whose revelations about the sexual abuse he suffered as a child in football sent shockwaves, has slammed the FA's handling of the matter.

item.title: Don't make me beg! Puppy can't keep its eyes off owner's popcorn but she's not sharing
item.description: Kristen Kato, from Las Vegas, Nevada, filmed her dog staring at her, hoping to get a share of her tasty snack. In the footage, from July 31, the beagle-corgi mix refuses to take its eyes of the popcorn.

item.title: Over a million live in subterranean Cold War tunnels in China
item.description: The underground city, dubbed 'The Dungeon', was constructed in 1969 when the threat of nuclear war was at its peak.

item.title: Grace Millane's murderer appeals his conviction and life in jail
item.description: The 28-year-old is appealing his conviction and life sentence for strangling British backpacker Grace Millane during 'rough sex' in a New Zealand hotel room on December 1, 2018.

item.title: Gordon Ramsay savages aspiring chefs on TikTok
item.description: Gordon Ramsay, 53, is currently staying in the Cornwall home he shares with wife Tana, 45, and his five children. He has shared a series of videos mocking home cooks on TikTok

item.title: Personal trainer shares images of her body to show why 'transformation' pictures AREN'T real
item.description: An Australian personal trainer has shunned thin people trying 'normalise' body rolls and cellulite in photos by sharing a series of images she took seconds apart.

item.title: Thrifty woman transforms her 'plain' bathroom into vibrant space for £100
item.description: Kelli Cochran-Sharp, a lecturer from Inverness, Scotland, took to Facebook group DIY On A Budget , to share her lockdown project, which she completed by herself for just £116.49.

item.title: Australians slam woman's 'pasta grazing board' as a 'failure of modern civilisation'
item.description: In a video shared on the social media platform, the woman, from America, is seen covering a table with tinfoil, then scooping large quantities of cooked pasta and garlic bread on top for guests to share from.

item.title: Failings by NHS 111 service 'left our loved ones doomed to die', bereaved families tell MPs
item.description: Four people who each lost their fathers to the virus gave evidence to the newly-formed All Party Parliamentary Group on coronavirus. Pictured: Layla Moran hosting the inaugural group.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... back to school
item.description: 'Back to school in September? I thought I was in a 'lethargy bubble' with dad'

item.title: Melburnians flock to city market as the streets around them turn into a hellish police state
item.description: Melburnians faced with day one of a new stage-four hard lockdown have flocked to a city market as police and soldiers converged on surrounding streets in a show of force.

item.title: The 10 most popular perfumes of all time - including Chanel No.5 and a 'holiday in a bottle'
item.description: Chanel's iconic 'Number Five', a scent described as 'a holiday in a bottle' and a fragrance that took three years to create are among the most popular perfumes of all time, according to Glamour magazine.

item.title: Some children find spending time in nature 'distressing' over climate change triggers
item.description: 'Troubling emotions' and their link to climate change have been studied by University of Colombia researchers for the British Ecological Society in a first of its kind study.
